metadata.value: A miniature of the Annunciation surrounded by a floral border, containing angel figures. An angel, dressed in a red robe with a blue cape, kneels on the left of the miniature, a flowing scroll emerging from his hand which contains the word of God. Mary kneels to the right of the miniature, wearing a maroon dress and a blue cape, a golden halo around her head. The figures are situated in the interior of a building or church, with red walls and a blue ceiling. A book sits open on a table behind Mary. Directly below the miniature are 4 lines of text and an illuminated initial. Three angels, dressed in white robes with yellow collars, hold flowers and acanthus leaves in the border, two below the miniature and one to the right.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: Written in France, possibly Paris, in the 15th century for an unknown individual or organization. An 18th century inscription reads "The Gift of the Rev'd Edward Thorold" and a bookplate from Syston Park. Above this bookplate is a label with the monogram JHT, for J.H. Thorold.
metadata.label: Provenance Notes

metadata.value: A miniature of the Nativity surrounted by a floral border, featuring figures of men. Mary kneels in the foreground, dressed in a maroon robe with a gold belt and blue cloak. She has a golden halo around her head. Behind her, Joseph kneels, dressed in a red tunic and blue robe. To the right is the baby Jesus, naked in the manger, but for a gold halo around his head. Behind him, two men, one dressed in blue and the other in red, both wearing black hats, peek over the wall of the barn and point and whisper. A barn roof is above all the figures, and a river runs through a natural backround beyond. Below the miniature are 4 lines of Latin text featuring a large illuminated initial. Within the border, 4 figures of men appear. Clockwise from lower right corner: A man in a maroon tunic, black tights, and a white headpiece holds a bow and arrow; a man in a blue tunic, white tights, maroon shoes, and fancy blue hat holds a sprig of berries that are larger than he is; a man in a red tunic with white undershirt, white trousers, and a white hat pulls at some blue flowers that are taller than he is; a man in a blue tunic with white tights, maroon socks, and balck shoes, wearing a red hat, leaps forward holding a sprig of flowers larger than he is.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: Written in France, possibly Paris, in the 15th century for an unknown individual or organization. An 18th century inscription reads "The Gift of the Rev'd Edward Thorold" and a bookplate from Syston Park. Above this bookplate is a label with the monogram JHT, for J.H. Thorold.
metadata.label: Provenance Notes

label: Ms-310
